thread.title: Vikings ready for another Thursday subregion showdown, face Drew
thread.title_full: Vikings ready for another Thursday subregion showdown, face Drew

title: Vikings ready for another Thursday subregion showdown, face Drew
text:
Vikings ready for another Thursday subregion showdown, face Drew by 
All it takes is one look at the numbers, and it's hard not to be impressed by what's happening on the football field at Northgate. 
The Vikings have rolled to a 7-0 overall record and a 4-0 mark against Region 4A- competition. 
With the fast start has come a blueprint on how to play both offense and defense. 
Northgate has outscored its opponents 343-20 and earned shutouts in four of its seven games. 
Tonight, however, the Vikings face what could be their biggest challenge so far this season when they face Drew at Southern Crescent Stadium in Riverdale. 
It's the second time this year Northgate has made the trek to Clayton County for a Thursday game after rolling to a 56-0 victory over Morrow at Tara Stadium earlier this year. 
The Titans (5-2, 3-1) are in the hunt to compete in one of the three region playin games on Nov. 6, that will determine state berths from Region 4- . Currently Northgate and Starr's Mill share the subregion lead while both at 7-0 and 4-0. 
'This is by far our biggest game and toughest opponent so far this season, Walburn said. 'I really think we need a game like this.' 
A win tonight would also guarantee the Vikings a berth in one of those crucial play-n games, with a showdown looming against Starr's Mill next week for what could be the subregion title and an automatic berth in the Class state playoffs. 
The Vikings wing-t offense is averaging 409 points per game, including 315 yards on the ground. 
Junior running back Ton Evans is closing in on his second straight 1,000-yard season. Evans has rushed for 926 yards on 98 carries, finding the end zone 13 times. Teammate Kyle Cater has rushed for 503 yards and 10 touchdowns. 
One of the keys for Vikings this season has been the ability to hold on to the ball Through seven games, the Vikings have just seven turnovers. 
Sophomore quarterback Kyle McLaren is 26 of 40 passing for 643 yards with nine touchdowns and just two interceptions. 
Tight end Chris Age has turned into his favorite target with seven catches. Kamari Ray has four catches, including two for touchdowns. 
Defensively the numbers have been just as eye-popping. Last week in the team's 68-0 victory over Forest Park, the Vikings had a season's worth of sacks, finishing with 21. 
Linebackers Carson Storey and Drew Latham each had 4 1/2 and James Skalski had 3 sacks. The three defenders also combined for 26 1/2 tackles last week in two quarters of play. 
Despite a coordinator change from retired assistant Bubba Geter to Davis Russell, the Vikings haven't skipped a beat. 
'He has come in a done a great job taking over the defense,' Walburn said. 'We have tweaked a few things, but the kids have really responded.' 
Tonight, the Vikings face what could be their biggest challenge when they travel to Drew High School in Riverdale. 
The Titans (5-2, 3-1) are in the hunt for one of the two playoffs spots in the subregion along with Northgate and Starr's Mill (7-0, 4-0), the Vikings opponent next week. 
Drew has won its last two contests, beating Morrow 54-0 and holding off Mundy's Mill 36-26 last week. 
The Titans have outscored opponents 309-148. Northgate beat Drew 48-20 in last year meeting and will face some of the same personnel this season. 
Senior quarterback Joseph Newman has completed 71 passes for 902 yards and 12 touchdowns, while senior running back Quarderman Sloan leads the team with 1,215 yards with five 100-plus yard efforts. 
Cedric Davenport is the team's leading receiver with 22 catches. 
'They have some really good athletes,' Walburn said. 'Their coaching staff has done a really good job.' 
Dorwyn Lyles, who has gone 12-6 over two seasons, was promoted last season when Jarrett Laws was named head coach at Griffin. More
